page.title: 02FORESTRY
page.content: Forestry covers the majority of our block. It is owned by the Blair Adam Forestry Commission. It covers a total area of 315 hectares. The land has been owned by the Forestry Commission since the 1920's. The Forestry Commission have expanded their planted area to cover the whole of Outh Muir. Types of trees grown are Sitka Spruce and Lodge Pole Pine which grow best in peaty soil with high exposure and high elevation.The Sitka Spruce takes 50_60 years to reach felling age.The main hardwoods are Beech and Larch. The Forestry Commission has charge of two harvesting machines.They also call in three contractors to tackle any difficult areas.
